mario.name: [the extension name, must equals to folder name under ./extensions folder]

entry.name: [the property name, must be unique in each extension.xml]
entry.variables: [the PuElement's xml format, using variable and entry tags]

sql.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
sql.name: [sql-source-name]
sql.propertiesFile: [file config path, relative to this file, optional]

cassandra.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
cassandra.name: [cassandra_datasource_name]

mongodb.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
mongodb.name: [mongodb-name]

readpreference.name: [NEAREST | PRIMARY | SECONDARY | SECONDARY_PREFERRED | PRIMARY_PREFERRED, default is primary, case insensitive]

hazelcast.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
hazelcast.name: default-hazelcast
hazelcast.autoinit: [used if lazyinit == true, auto init on extension ready]

redis.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
redis.name: default-redis

rabbitmq.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
rabbitmq.name: [rabbitmq_connection_pool]

http.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
http.name: [http_context_name]

taskqueue.initsize: [init BlockingArrayQueue with a backed elements Object[].length == this size configuration, default is 8]
taskqueue.growby: [the backed elements array will be grown by this configuration, default is 8]
taskqueue.maxsize: [maximum size of the backed task queue, default is Integer.MAX_VALUE]

http.sessiontimeout: [timeout_in_second (default = -1 mean forever)] (this will be ignored if options != sessions)

kafka.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
kafka.name: [kafka_server_wrapper_name]

rabbitmq.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
rabbitmq.name: [producer_name, used for getApi to locate]

queue.name: [queueName]
queue.routingKey: [rountingKey, default will be queueName if exchangeName == null or emplty]

http.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
http.name: [producer_name]

kafka.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
kafka.name: [producer_name]

http.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
http.name: [http_gateway_name]

rabbitmq.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
rabbitmq.name: [rabbitmq_gateway_name]

queue.name: [queueName ** not require if type == pub_sub or routing]
queue.autoack: [true (default) | false ** if false, ack will be send when consumer process done]
queue.routingKey: [rountingKey, default will be queueName if exchangeName == null or empty]

socket.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
socket.name: default-tcp
socket.autoactivechannel: [for websocket only, auto active channel after connect, for render test page, set to false, default true]
socket.bootGroupThreads: [number of thread use for boot event loop group, default 2]
socket.workerGroupThreads: [number of threads use for worker event loop group, default 4]

kafka.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
kafka.name: [name]
kafka.deserializer: [deserializer_class | shouldn't set this if you don't know what are you doing]
kafka.pollTimeout: [poll_timeout in milli seconds, default 10ms. It should be less than minBatchingSize]
kafka.minBatchingSize: [min record(s) will be published to worker. If it less than or equals 0, gateway will split a batch into single pieces before publish to worker, otherwise, whole batch will be re-batched until: - the new batch size reach greater than or equals minBatchingSize or - maxRetentionTime reached. Default == 0]
kafka.maxRetentionTime: [used when minBatchingSize > 0, default 100ms, max time for gateway to wait for batch tobe filled with records]

zookeeper.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
zookeeper.name: [zkclient_name]
zookeeper.servers: [the endpoints separated by comma, e.g host1:port1,host2:port2]

contact.name: [the contact name]
contact.telegram: [telegram userName - *** user must set it in profile setting ***]

email.name: [name for the email service]
email.handle: [default is com.mario.services.email.DefaultEmailService, custom class must implements EmailService]

outgoing.from: [email address will be set to "from" field before send]

authenticator.username: [if smtp mail server require user to send email]

sms.name: [sms service name]
sms.handle: [class name which implement SMSService interface, use to send sms to a contact]

telegrambot.name: [service name use in MarioApi.getTelegramBot(name) method]
telegrambot.register: [lazy | immediately (default) - if set to lazy, when MarioApi.getTelegramBot() is called, then bot will be registered]
telegrambot.type: [webhook | long_polling (default) - *** for now, support only LONG_POLLING bot type ***]

storage.datasource: [datasource name - use for mysql | mongo storage type]

hazelcast.name: [name of the scheduler, shouldn't have any space]
hazelcast.hazelcastName: [name of the hazelcast instance which can be acquired via MarioAPI.getHazelcastInstance(name)]

agent.ref: [the property which hold the config, optional]
agent.name: [agent-name]
agent.scheduler: [scheduler name - optional, if not specific, auto use default Mario local scheduler]

alert.autoSendRecovery: [true (default) | false - recipients will got alert if status ok occurs after warning or critical]
